section.title: Introduction
section.para: The dcm4chee User Interface Guide was written for system administrators, which are responsible for the adminstration of dcm4chee archive application. dcm4chee-web is an administration tool of the dcm4chee Archive application. dcm4chee-web will support the user with functionality in:

listitem.para: Archive Content Administration
AE Management
Offline Storage
Worklist Console
MPPS Console
User admin
Audit Repository

section.para: dcm4chee-web is based on a web-interface, which means that users with a basic knowledge of how to use the functionality in a browser can use the system. This document will not describe the functions in the web-browser in detail, but assumes that the user had this knowledge prior to the use of dcm4che-web.

The webbrowser used in this document is Firefox version 1.5.0.3. Other browsers can have a slightly different layout and colourchart, but the functionality will be the same as described in this document.

section.title: User Login
section.para: For log-on to the system the user must type in Username and Password.

The user is log-on to the system until the web-browser is closed, which means, that the user can go to other web-sites and back to dcm4chee-web without doing a new log-on to the system. The user should be aware of the security issues having a browser open that is log-on to the system, and therefore we recommend to log out of the system whenever the dcm4chee-web is not in use.

section.title: Archive Content Administration
section.para: To administrate the archive content – for example to add or merge patients and to move images and/or studies between patients – click on Folder in the header line of dcm4chee-web.
The folder window can be divided into three logical parts:

listitem.para: Information regarding patients, studies, series, and images.
Specifies matching criteria for listed studies.
Invokes particular operations on selected list entires.

section.title: Study List
section.para: The study list contains information on four levels:

listitem.para: Patient - marked with green.
Study - marked with light green.
Series - marked with grey.
Instance (image) – marked with light grey.
File – marked with white.

section.para: To expand a line for subsequent info lines click on the + sign, and to hide subsequent info lines click on the – sign.
In the figure above the patient AAPM Test Pattern has four OT-study with a few series. The second series contains three images.
The label for a column can be seen on the top of each column. The information at the Patient level is – all in bold:

listitem.para: Name
Patient ID
Birthdate
Sex

section.para: At the Study level the information is:

listitem.para: Date/Time
Study ID
Modalities
Study Description/IUID (Instance Unique Identifier)
Accession Number
Referring Physician
Number of Series
Number of Instances/Images

section.para: By clicking either Study Description or IUID it is possible to toggle between Study Description and IUID information in the column Study Description/IUID. If Study Instance UID is active the search field Study ID changed to Study IUID. Therewith it is possible to search for a certain study instance UID.
The information at the Series level is:

listitem.para: Data/Time
Series Number
Modality
Series Description/Body Part/IUID (Series Instance Unique Identifier)
Vendor/Model
Number of Images

section.para: By clicking either Series Description/Body Part or IUID it is possible to toggle between Series Description/Body Part and IUID information in the column Series Description/Body Part/IUID.

section.title: Search Filter
section.para: To easily find a record in the study list, a search filter can be specified above the columns labels. It is possible to search for Patient Name, Patient ID, Study ID, Study Data, Accession Number, Modality, or a combination of these. To perform a search just press “Return” on the keyboard or click the New Search button. The result of the search will be displayed in the list. If the list contains more than ten studies (records), the first ten records will be shown. To show the next ten records press the Next Search Result button or go back using the Previous Search Result button. Information regarding what is displayed, and the total amount of matching records can be seen in the status line – ex.:
“Displaying studies 1 to 10 of 29 matching studies”

The search can include a specific entry or part of an entry truncated with a question mark (?) or an asterisk (*). A search including a question mark will only search for one character where it is placed, opposite a search with an asterisk will include an unlimited amount of characters. It is possible to combine question marks and asterisk in the same search.
All fields are case sensitive – except the Patient Name Field.
The above figure shows a search for patients named starting with “M*”.

section.title: Functions Buttons
section.para: The buttons for functions in dcm4chee-web can be divided into two – the buttons placed in the header section of the window, and the buttons placed next to the entities in the folder.

section.title: Functions Buttons in the header section
New Search
section.para: After typing in the search string in the related fields, a click on this button will perform a search in the database. As an alternative, the “Return” button on the keyboard will also perform a search. For a more detailed description of the search field see .

section.title: Previous Search Results
section.para: A click on this button will show the previous page in the search. If the first page or the one and only page in a search are shown, no activity is related to the button.

section.title: Next Search Results
section.para: A click on this button will show the next page of records in the search (if the total amount of records is larger than one page). If the last page or the one and only page in a search are shown, no activity is related to the button.

section.title: Add New Patient
section.para: To add a new patient, click this button and fill out the fields in the window. The fields are:

listitem.para: The ID of the patient – typically a person number, social security number, or another unique patient identifier generated or handled by a Hospital Information System, Patient Administration System, or a Radiology Information System.
Identifier of the assigning authority (system, organization, agency or department) that issued the Patient ID.
The name of the patient.
Choose sex between Female, Male, and Other (unknown) clicking on the arrow.
The birth date of the patient in the format yyyy/mm/dd

section.title: Merge Selected Patient
section.para: To merge two (or more) patients in dcm4chee-web, the patients must be marked with a click in the checkbox next to the patients. The boxes will now contain a checkmark. It is not possible to merge patients by a checkmark at the study or series level.

After the patients have been marked in the folder list, click on the button “Merge Selected Patients”. This shows the list of patients that will be merged. In the column Patient ID click the checkbox to mark which patient should be the remaining patient. Click Merge to merge the patients or Cancel to cancel the operation.

section.title: Move Selected Items
section.para: To move one or several items the source and the destination must be selected. To select a source or a destination just mark it in the checkbox next to the entity.
There are some selection rules for source and destination:

listitem.para: The destination is always at the highest selected level in the hierarchic patient, study, series and instance.
The source will always be the entity (or entities) at the lowest level in the hierarchic patient, study, series, and instance.
Only one destination is allowed.
The sources have to be only one hierarchic level under the destination.
The destination must not be the parent of the sources.

section.title: To Move a Study to another Patient

listitem.para: Click the checkbox next to the study (or studies) to mark it.
Click the checkbox next to the patient (destination) to mark it.
Click the button “Move Selected Items” to perform the move.

section.title: To Move a Series to another Study

listitem.para: Click the checkbox next to the one (or several) series to mark it.
Click the checkbox next to the study (destination) to mark it.
Click the button “Move Selected Items” to perform the move.

section.title: To Move a Instance to another Series

listitem.para: Click the checkbox next to the instance (or instances) to mark it.
Click the checkbox next to the series (destination) to mark it.
Click the button “Move Selected Items” to perform the move.

section.title: Export Teaching Files
section.para: To export an entity or several entities (patient, study, series, or instance/image) click the check checkbox next to the line or lines to mark the entity/entities..
Click the button “Export selected instances to Teaching File Sytem” to export the entity or entities marked.
In the next window you can select different export options and define optional included additional Teaching File Information.

section.title: Provide and Register Imaging Document Set at XDS-I Repository
section.para: To register an image document set click the checkbox next to the line or lines to mark the entity/entities.
In the next window you can edit your XDS-I metadata, which will be exported with selected entities as a Key Object.

section.title: Move Selected Entities into the Trash
section.para: To delete an entity or several entities (patient, study, series, or instance/image) click the checkbox next to the line or lines to mark the entity/entities.
Click the button “Delete Selected Entities” to delete the entity or entities marked. Confirm or cancel the operation by clicking the appropriate button in the pop-up window.

section.title: Delete Selected Entities irrevocably
section.para: If you want to delete the entities irrevocably, you have to select the Trash folder and select the entities, which you want to delete. Then you press the “Delete selected Entities” button to delete the entities irrevocably.

section.title: Undelete Selected Entities
section.para: To undelete entities in the Trash folder you have to press the “Undelete” button.

section.title: Send Selected Entities to Specified Destination
section.para: To send an entity or several entities (patient, study, series, or instance/image) to a DICOM destination click the checkbox next to the line or lines to mark the entity/entities.
From the drop-down menu choose which AE Title to send the entity or entities to.
Click the button “Send Selected Entities to Specified Destination” to send the entity or entities marked. Confirm or cancel the operation by clicking the appropriate button in the pop-up window.

section.title: Function buttons next to the entities in the folder
Edit Patient Attributes
section.para: Click the button “Edit Patients Attributes” to edit patient information.
Click the button “Update” to update the patient attributes or “Cancel” to quit without updating the attributes.

section.title: Edit Study Attributes
section.para: Click the button “Edit Study Attributes” to edit study information.
Click the button “Update” to update the study attributes or “Cancel” to quit without updating the attributes.

section.title: Edit Series Attributes
section.para: Click the button “Edit Series Attributes” to edit series information.
Click the button “Update” to update the series attributes or “Cancel” to quit without updating the attributes.

section.title: Add New Study
section.para: To add a new study click the “Add New Study” button, and fill out the fields with the appropriate information. Due to the fact, that dcm4chee-web creates a Study Instance UID itself, no fields are mandatory.
All fields can contain alphanumeric characters, except the Date/Time field, where the format yyyy/mm/dd should be used.
Click the button “Add Study” to add the new study or “Cancel” to quit without adding a new study.

section.title: Add New Series
section.para: To add a new series click the “Add New Series” button, and fill out the fields with the appropriate information. Due to the fact, that dcm4chee-web creates a Series Instance UID itself, only the modality field is mandatory.
All fields can contain alphanumeric characters, except the Date/Time field, where the format yyyy/mm/dd should be used.
Click the button “Add Series” to add the new series or “Cancel” to quit without adding a new series.

section.title: View Image
section.para: Click the button “View Image” to show the image. Icon appearances are dependent on the instance type/state.

section.title: View Report as HTML
section.para: Click the button “View Report as HTML” to show the structured report as HTML document. Icon appearances are dependent on the instance type/state.

section.title: View Report as PDF
section.para: Click the button “View Report as PDF” to show the structured report as pdf document. Icon appearances are dependent on the instance type/state.

section.title: View Waveform object
section.para: Click the button “View WaveForm” to show the WaveForm object as PDF. Icon appearances are dependent on the instance type/state.

section.title: Offline
section.para: Indicates that the instance is offline. Icon appearances are dependent on the instance type/state.

section.title: Application Entity (AE) Management
section.para: The AE Title, host names and port numbers of remote applications, to which the archive shall be able to connect, must be configured by the AE Management web page.
After clicking on AE Management, the following window will be shown:

listitem.para: The AE Title (AET) of the remote application
Host name or IP-address of the host of the remote application.
TCP port number of the remote application.
TLS Cipher Suites which are supported on this connection. No entry implies a direct (unsecure) DICOM connection (without TLS).

section.para:
To create a new connection click button
(Add New AET), and the window for creating a new AET opens.

Fill in the appropriate information for AE Title, Hostname (or IP-Address), Port number, and Cipher (for TLS connections over an un-trusted network connection). Be careful to type in the right information - dcm4chee-web does only check if the Port number is a number (if not the value is changed to “0”). Click on Create to create the entry in the AET-list or Cancel to leave without creating the entry in the AET-list.
For DICOM over TLS connections you can configure support of up to 3 different Cipher Suites:

listitem.para: No Encryption, only Entity Authentication by RSA based certificates & Data Integrity check by SHA hashing function
Use AES_128_CBC for Encryption
Use Triple DES EDE, CBC Encryption

section.para: The order defines the preferences e.g.:

listitem.para: TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
SSL_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA

section.para:
To change an entry in the AET-list click on the
(Edit), and the information for this entry is shown.
After changing the information click Apply Changes to apply the new information to the AET-list or Cancel to leave without changing the information.

To delete an entry, click the
(Delete), and confirm deletion by a click on OK in the pop-up window. To cancel deletion click Cancel.

section.title: OThe ID of the Scheduled Procedure Step IDffline Storage
section.para: This page shows the information of the off-line storage filesets (media).
There are several search parameters to choose between or combine.
In the Media Status pull down list it is possible to choose one or more (using SHIFT of CTRL keys on the keyboard together with a click on the left mouse button) of the following statuses:

listitem.para: List all File Sets.
Search for open file set – file set that are not scheduled for media creation, and therefore new studies can be added for offline storage
Search for filesets, that failed for one or another reason during media creation.
Search for filesets, that are queued – scheduled for media creation.
Search for filesets, that are transferring – transfer files to media creation server.
Search for filesets, that are during creation for the time being.
Search for filesets, that are completed

section.para: It is also possible to search for items in a specific time interval. The search can be for all activities, for media initialization dates, or for media modification dates. The time interval should be in the format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm:ss.
The six columns in the window show:

listitem.para: The ID of the fileset
The date and time where the media content was scheduled
The last date and time where the scheduled media content was modified
The usage of the media (in KB, MB, or GB)
Shows status of the file set:

open,
queued,
transferring,
creating,
completed,
failed.
Schedule open file set for media creation.
Delete file set - so associated files will be reassigned to another file set for media storage.

section.para:
A new search is performed by either pressing the
(New Search) or the Enter key at the keyboard.

section.title: Manual Offline Archiving
section.para:
If dcm4chee's Media Creation Service is configured to manual actitvation of the burning process, the administrator will receive an e-mail with information about the media. The administrator can see the status at the web-page and start the burning process by activating the start button
.

section.title: Automatic Offline Archiving
section.para: If dcm4chee's Media Creation Service is configured to automatic actitvation of the burning process, the administrator will only have to check the job status occasionally.

If a media has a status of failed
you may try a manual restart of the burning process by activating the start button
.

section.title: MPPS Console
section.para: This console is the tool to administrate the modality performed procedure step worklist information. The window is divided into three logical parts. The content of each part will be described below the figure.
By use of one or several search fields it is possible to search for specific information in the database. The search fields are:

listitem.para: The patient name.
The date and time (format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm) when the search should begin.
The date and time (format: yyyy/mm/dd hh:mm) where the search should end.
Type of modality (e.g. MR, CT, CR, and US).
The specific Application Entity Title of the modality.
The specific accession number for a study. If box is checked the search will include unscheduled examinations.

IN PROGRESS: Will only include procedures, that are in progress, in the search.
COMPLETED: Will only include procedures, that are completed, in the search.
DISCONTINUED: Will only include procedures, that are discontinued, in the search.

section.para:
The function buttons are the
(New Search) that will perform the search (alternative: press the Enter key) and the

The information regarding the modality performed procedure step worklist (MPPS) are shown in the table. The columns in the table are:

listitem.para: The accession number of the study.
IN PROGRESS: Will only include procedures, that are in progress, in the search.
COMPLETED: Will only include procedures, that are completed, in the search.
DISCONTINUED: Will only include procedures, that are discontinued, in the search.
The Study Instance UID.
Description of the performed procedure.
The date and time, when the procedure step started.
Name of device (modality) on which this Procedure Step was performed.
The number of instances.
The patient name.

The first window gives a list of users defined in the system.
For each user the roles are shown. The four roles that can be combined for each user are:

listitem.para: A user in this role is allowed to use this web interface.
A user in this role has admin rights in the web interface. To have WebAdmin rights the user also has to have the WebUser rights.
This role is used to allow configuration access via the JMX Console.
Members of this role are allowed to access the Audit Repository.

section.title: Audit Repository
section.para: The “Audit Record Repository List View” is divided into three logical parts:

listitem.para: The Search Section
The List Section
The Selection Section

section.title: List Section
section.para: The list section shows the result from the search and selection done in the left side of the window. The columns in the list are:

listitem.para: The type of the event logged in the audit repository and shown in the list.
The name of the host that sent the audit message.
The timestamp of the event. The format is: yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.sss
A short description of the event.

section.title: Search Section
section.para: In the search section it is possible to search for one of the following values, or for a combination of the following values. It is not possible to type in part of a search value or to truncate a value in the search fields. If a value is unknown, it is possible to use the search facility in the folder part to find the exact value to use in this section.

listitem.para: Typing in a figure in this field indicates how many results that should be shown on one page in the list.
The exact name of the patient that should be used in the search.
The exact patient ID that should be used in the search.
The exact AE Title that should be used in the search.
The exact username that should be used in the search.
The hostname that should be used in the search.
The two values (from and to) for exact time stamp, should be used in the search. The format is “yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.sss” – only whole values can be typed in (no truncation).

section.title: The selection section
section.para: In this section you can filter your results by choosing (one or several) audit log event types:

listitem.para: Generated for any configuration changes related to the actor.
Start-up and shutdown of any actor. Is distinct from hardware power-up and shutdown.
The audit trail repository has been accessed or modified by something other than the arrival of audit trail messages.
Begin storing SOP Instances for a study. This may be a mix of instances.
SOP Instances are deleted from a specific study.
Study is created, modified, or accessed. This report on addition of new instances to existing studies as well as creation of new studies.
A query has been received.
Any export of PHI on media, either removable physical media such as CD-ROM or electronic transfer of files such as email. Any printing activity, paper or film, local or remote, that prints PHI.
Any import of PHI on media, either removable physical media such as CD-ROM or electronic transfers of files such as email.
Instances for a particular study have been stored on this system.
Mobile machine joins or leaves secure domain.
Order record created, accessed, modified or deleted.
Patient record created, modified, or accessed.
Procedure record created, modified, accessed or deleted.
A secure node authentication failure has occurred during TLS negotiation, e.g. invalid certificate.
Shows events that have deleted studies.
Shows events related to user authentication.

section.title: Audit Record Detail View
section.para: To se the detailed information from the list section click one of the events in the first column (Audit Event) or the XML-hyperlink.
The Audit Record Detailed View shows the host name, time and parameters for the event. The parameters will be different for different types of events.
The information can also be shown in XML format.
